text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Lindy a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Cape Town
today I'm going to show you how you can
pay for your AWS spell in a non-usd
currency
let's get started to change the currency
associated with your AWS account sign in
to the AWS Management console and open
the AWS billing console
on the navigation bar in the upper right
corner choose your account name or Alias
and choose account
for select payment currency select the
new currency to pay your bill
supported currencies will be displayed
here
choose update
when using a non-usd currency consider
the following supported currencies vary
by seller of record and sometimes
supported payment method all preferred
currency amounts shown in the AWS
billing and cost Management console are
estimated in USD your finalized monthly
bill is generated in the local currency
that you choose rates can change daily
note currency conversion is provided by
Amazon Services LLC you can change your
local currency at any time but often
invoices finalized the invoice must be
paid in that currency
you can pay invoices in non-usd
currencies by using Visa or MasterCard
or other cards are charged only in USD
note
if you choose a payment currency that
the card issuer doesn't support then you
might be charged foreign currency
conversion charges or fees and now you
know how you can pay for your AWS bill
in a non-usd currency
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
